entry.title: [Autofill] Move popup-hiding on frame deletion to AutofillPopupControllerImpl
entry.content:
The Autofill popup should should be closed when

- the frame that contains the associated field is removed, or

- the visibility of the tab changes.

Before this CL, this logic lived in ContentAutofillDriverFactory.



This CL moves this mechanism to AutofillPopupControllerImpl (Chrome)

and AutofillProviderAndroid (WebView): both now observe

RenderFrameDeleted() and OnVisibilityChanged() to close the

popup.



This is the final step to remove

ContentAutofillRouter::last_queried_{source,target}_.



Bug: 1443645, 1187842

entry.title: [sign-in/egtests] Support signed-in user opting into history sync
entry.content:
With kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos off, it's possible to call

[SigninEarlGreyUI signinWithFakeIdentity:id enableSync:YES] to enable

sync for a signed-in non-syncing user. At least one test [1] relies on

this. The method name is not great in this case given the user is

already signed-in, but that's a pre-existing issue.



This CL adds the same support for when the flag is on. As with

https://crrev.com/c/4801338, the outcome is a history sync opt-in.



[1] BringAndroidTabsNoInitialAlertTestCase/testUserWhoIsNotEnrolledInSyncShouldNotSeePromptUntilSync



Bug: 1462156

entry.title: Revert "Use unique trace ids for console timings with different names"
entry.content:
This reverts commit d9112555e291d0bf358fa24264b138549a33a759.



Reason for revert: Causing https://crbug.com/1475959



Original change's description:

> Use unique trace ids for console timings with different names

>

> Console timing events can be used to measure the duration of a task in

> JS and the recorded data is added to the performance panel timeline data

> via trace events. A console.time('name') event dispatches a trace begin

> event and a console.end('name') dispatches a trace end event.

>

> Before this cl, the trace id used to dispatch console timing events was

> a pointer to the process and, as a consequence, was shared within

> console timing events in the same process, regardless of the console

> timing name. This was problematic because the trace id is used to match

> trace begin and end events. Meaning that the trace end event dispatched for a given console.end will always be matched with the latest trace begin event that was dispatched. However, there is no guarantee that a console.end call is intended to end the last console.time call. Instead they should be matched by name, which this CL achieves by using the timing name the API was called with in the id of the trace event.

>

> Co-authored-by: jacktfranklin@chromium.org

> Fixed: 1455582

>

> Change-Id: I3a4d463254e4137861e7065cb3e4ea9e11476ec4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665408

> Reviewed-by: Yang Guo

> Commit-Queue: Andres Olivares

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169185}

Bug: 1475959



Change-Id: I6e9a3c52c46c9ed008b5635e5d139d5e93cc072f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4822848

Reviewed-by: Simon Zünd

Reviewed-by: Alex Rudenko

Commit-Queue: Andres Olivares

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190042}

entry.title: [office] fix UMA logging on QuickOffice fallback
entry.content:
When opening a file fails and the user is presented with a QuickOffice

fallback dialog, log metrics as follows:



- Log open result only once after the last try, before the user selects

QuickOffice or cancel, to have task result count be consistent with

open result count. Failure codes will be the same between retries in

the majority of cases.

- Log cancellation from the fallback dialog as kCancelled instead of

kFailedToOpen.



Bug: b/296950967

Change-Id: I33acc2e36c17641a0eaaf4af6392bf2ccf23bf6e

entry.title: [PA] Templatenize alloc flags
entry.content:
- Move |unsigned int flags| param to template parameter.

- Merge |AllocWithFlags| into |Alloc|

- Add |AllocInline| for inlined |Alloc|

- Rename |AlignedAllocWithFlags| into |AlignedAlloc|

- Add |AlignedAllocInline| for inlined |AlignedAlloc|

- Merge |ReallocWithFlags| into |Realloc|

- Add |ReallocInline| for inlined |Realloc|

- constexpr-nized if over flags

- Explicitly instantiate |Alloc|, |AlignedAlloc|, |Realloc|

- This should save some compile time





free flags were templatenized in: crrev.com/c/4722182



Change-Id: I783c7df9d95d8fb1388a5ecfc444db890d3cd6a8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4750750

entry.title: Add UMA AutoPreloadResponseReceivedToFetchHandlerEnd
entry.content:
This CL adds new timing metric,

AutoPreloadResponseReceivedToFetchHandlerEnd in ServiceWorker.LoadTiming

for both main and subresource.



This metric measures the time between 1) the response received time of

the network request (AutoPreload), 2) the fetch handler completion time.



We use this metric to know how much resource loadings are still

intercepted by the fetch handlers when ServiceWorkerAutoPreload is

enabled.



Bug: 1472634

entry.title: [file manager] Remove availableOffline from testCSEFile
entry.content:
The `availableOffline: true` flag to the test entry mentioned was added

to remove `dim-offline` class from the file item so the

`openFileDialogExpectEntryDimmed` test would be able to easily check if

the file is dimmed.



However, by making the check slightly more explicit we are able not to

rely anymore on the offline availability of the entry. This is a prework

for making and testing future changes in the way how we deal with

encrypted files without an internet connection.



Verified that the test is still valid by temporary disabling

encrypted-dimming code in `file_table_list.js`.

entry.title: WebNN: Ensure CommandQueue completes all pending work for DML backend
entry.content:
This CL defines the PendingWorkDelegate class. It will be created in

the destruction of CommandQueue if there is still some pending work

on GPU. CommandQueue transfers its' queued objects to the

PendingWorkDelegate to ensure them alive because they may still be

used by the pending queued work on GPU. CommandQueue delegates to

PendingWorkDelegate to wait for all pending work on GPU to complete

before destructing CommandQueue itself. PendingWorkDelegate will

delete itself after all pending work is completed.



Bug: 1273291

entry.title: [iOS] Add account picker UI for Save to Photos
entry.content:
This CL is the fourth and final step to create a self-contained

AccountPickerCoordinator which can be used to present the sign-in

"bottom sheet" for other purposes e.g. pick an account to save an image

to Google Photos. This should be generic so it can be used to implement

the ConsistencyPromoSigninCoordinator as a follow-up (it would then own

an AccountPickerCoordinator instance).



This AccountPickerCoordinator is self-contained - as in not owned by the

browser coordinator (or scene controller) to be triggered using the

command dispatcher. Instead it can be owned i.e. created and started by

any feature that might need to ask the user to pick an account on the

device to perform some action.



This code is essentially copy-pasted from

`i/c/b/ui/authentication/signin/consistency_promo_signin/`.



Low-Coverage-Reason: copy-pasted, is tested in ConsistencyPromo EG tests

Fixed: 1469555

Change-Id: I412a52fe7e53db1c301b5518d2bec735af189044

Commit-Queue: Quentin Pubert

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190005}

entry.title: Split LayoutSVGPath::UpdateMarkers into positions and bounds parts
entry.content:
The positions of the markers depend on the shape's geometry, and thus

need to be updated whenever the shape's geometry changes. The bounds

contribute to the visual overflow, and thus depend on the shape's

geometry as well as stroke width and the properties of the markers

themselves.



The split allows the bounds to be updated independently of the

positions, thus allowing certain mutations to be performed in a more

"direct" fashion (for example changes to a does not require the

shape's geometry to be updated).



Bug: 709437, 1393554

Change-Id: Ic706a9c44ba796288e4435af065f484fc98d75f0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4818686

Reviewed-by: Philip Rogers

Commit-Queue: Fredrik Söderquist

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190004}

entry.title: Fix GoogleServicesSettingsTestCase + kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos
entry.content:
These tests otherwise fail if kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos is

enabled. The reason is that, when the "allow sign-in" toggle is turned

off while the user is signed in, one extra dialog is displayed

depending on whether the user had turned sync (the feature) on. Whether

or not sync-the-feature is on, due to how `signinWithFakeIdentity` is

implemented, depends on whether feature

kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos' value.



Hence, tests covering this flow need to be influenced based on the

feature toggle's value. To achieve this, a new test is introduced for

the feature-enabled case, and for all relevant tests (including the new

one) the value for kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos is overridden

explicitly.



Change-Id: Ifb06af0ed258e1b6ec83894b62b26e85de269617

entry.title: [A11y] Remove DidInsertChildrenOfNode()
entry.content:
This is redundant with the work performed by NodeIsAttached(), now

that NodeIsAttached() is called for display:none and display locked

subtrees.



Explanation of change to browser_accessibility_aura_linux:

Removed code that discarded children-changed:remove during page load.

This is an unnecessary optimization from CL:1569010 that caused a change

in test results for the navigation-api.html events test. It caused a

problem because that code is called before BrowserAccessibilityManager

learns that the page load is actually complete (the AXTreeData data_

field in AXTree is not updated until later in AXTree::Unserialize()).

In addition, while the code to discard children-changed:add does reduce

noise during page load, there is no value to discarding

children-changed:remove during page load. Another potential fix would

be to update the AXTreeData() earlier in Unserialize(), but this would

be riskier.



Bug: none

entry.title: Remove two DumpWithoutCrashing calls in GridViewController
entry.content:
GridViewController sometimes gets incorrect calls from iOS. There is a

workaround in place, but it was not clear whether it was still necessary

in recent versions. Looks like it is, as we get DumpWithoutCrashing

reports.



This CL removes the DumpWithoutCrashing, in order to not muddy the crash

tool. (If we want to later assess if the workaround is still needed, we

can add them back in future releases).

entry.title: [TTFPassGen] Trigger the keyboard after bottom sheet is dismissed
entry.content:
When user clicks "Create my own" (password) in the bottom sheet, it

should trigger the keyboard for the password field focused.



Important: now the keyboard is technically triggered before the bottom

sheet hiding animation is finished. I don't see any weirdness here on my

test phone, so I decided to keep it easy until we find any problems with

this.

One more important thing: theoretically during the time while the bottom

sheet is displayed, the field might lose focus. We don't check here if

the password field is still focused.

entry.title: ambient: remove kReleaseWakeLockDelay
entry.content:
|kReleaseWakeLockDelay| is an experimental value we found denoting the

time from releaseing the wake lock to the display actually being turned

off. The delay is defined by the inactivity timer per crbug.com/190499.

For screen saver duration, since all the options are at least 5 minutes,

the duration should be insensitive to an extra 38 seconds delay. Remove

the delay for code simplicity.

entry.title: Observe AutofillManager directly from iOS PWM client.
entry.content:
Currently, server predictions from Autofill reach PWM as follows:

- AutofillManager calls AutofillClient::PropagateAutofillPredictions.

- AutofillClient calls PWM::ProcessAutofillPredictions.



This CL changes it to:

- ChromePasswordManagerClient observes AutofillManager

- OnFieldTypesDetermined calls PWM::ProcessAutofillPredictions.



The intention behind this change is to make coupling between Autofill

and its consumers more loose - if another component wants to use

Autofill server predictions, they only need to observe AutofillManager.



As a result of this change, ChromeAutofillClient no longer needs to keep

a raw pointer to PasswordManager. This CL therefore removes that member

and the respective constructor argument.





Bug: 1466435

Change-Id: Iefea8927436a124a65e8759dcd3777017e901cf2

entry.title: [Autofill] Migrate BAMTestDelegate to AM::Observer
entry.content:
BrowserAutofillManagerTestDelegate is a member whose events are

triggered in selected places of BAM.



This CL makes BrowserAutofillManagerTestDelegate an ordinary

AutofillManager::Observer. This reduces test-only code in BAM.

The cost is adding two new events to AM::Observer that are

currently only used for tests but could be useful for production

code as well.



BrowserAutofillManagerTestDelegate::Did{Preview,Fill}FormData() are

now triggered synchronously. This affects interactive UI tests and

might fix some race conditions in their expectations.



The popup-related events should be revisited in the future to see

where exactly they should be triggered (renderer vs browser; BAM vs

AED) and where they handled (AM vs BAM vs AED).



This is an intermediate step towards eliminating

BrowserAutofillManagerTestDelegate altogether.



Bug: 1476270, 1119526

Change-Id: I5e104e6726ecf641211c4cbe6264bceb8db0cc78

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4812343

entry.title: Do not trigger linux-blink-rel in CQ
entry.content:
linux-blink-rel is an optional CQ builder. Besides webdriver tests,

it runs variations of blink_web/wpt_tests, which is duplicated to

linux-rel.



DO not trigger linux-blink-rel optionally to save CQ resources.



A difference between linux-blink-rel and linux-rel is that DCHECK is

enabled on linux-rel, but not on linux-blink-rel. This could lose

some coverage for DCHECK disabled case, but as DCHECK is also disabled

on CI builders, we should still be able to catch bugs. And if we see

increased revert rate due to this, we can always revert this CL.



Bug: None

entry.title: media/video/h265_parser: Provide default for PPS uniform_spacing_flag
entry.content:
The uniform_spacing_flag in the PPS being present in the bitstream is

conditional on tiles_enabled_flag being set. The standard says: "When

not present, the value of uniform_spacing_flag is inferred to be equal

to 1." This default is not set in our parser.



Set the default as required.



Also fix up the type of loop_filter_across_tiles_enabled_flag's default

value to match its type.

entry.title: CCA: Fix window not suspending while resuming
entry.content:
Currently, if a CCA window is being resumed from minimized state, and

the resume callback takes some time, and CCA is being minimized again

while resuming, the window will never be suspended after the resume

callback finished. Fix this by having a separate state for

pendingTransition to indicates that the MultiWindowManager should

suspend the current window immediately after it's resumed.



Also make it a little bit more robust by catching all error from the

suspend / resume callbacks, so failure on one CCA window won't affect

unrelated other window.



BUG=None

TEST=manually

TEST=camera.CCAUISmoke.* camera.CCAUIStress.*

entry.title: [HitTestOpaqueness] Separate hit test transparency under another flag
entry.content:
cc::HitTestOpaqueness::kTransparent is to optimize non-hit-testable

layers e.g. with pointer-events:none. It has little to do with

kFailedHitTest so I'm separating it under another flag

HitTestTransparency. This is also to make HitTestOpaqueness safe

by not marking any layer non-hit-testable (which is the same as

that HitTestOpaqueness is not enabled). We also seem to have some

bug that some layer would have wrong transparent to hit test status

(see tryjob results of crrev.com/c/4818488/1.

entry.title: [Files]: Add ability for RecentModel to limit wait for results.
entry.content:
In the current implementation RecentModel can wait indefinitely for a

response from any given RecentSource. While this is perfectly fine

solution for local sources, it may become problematic especially for

volumes that represent cloud based file systems. In this CL we add the

ability to set and clear the scan timeout. If set, it puts a hard limit

by which sources have to respond to have their results included in the

response to GetRecentFiles call. By default the limit is not set, to make the RecentModel behave as it was before this CL.

entry.title: CCA: Flatten CCA initialization in main.ts
entry.content:
The current CCA initialization flow consist of three parts:

* In the module level (async () => {})().

* In the App constructor.

* In the App.start.



This makes it a bit harder to follow the overall initialization order.



Flattern all initialization into a "main" function instead of having a

App class, and change the necessary member variables to local variables.



This CL is merely a mechanical rewrite and subsequent CL will focus on

cleanup the initialization order.



BUG=None

TEST=cca.py tsc

TEST=tast run camera.CCAUIStress* camera.CCAUISmoke*

entry.title: [BRP] Use universal references in raw_ptr_cast.h
entry.content:
We need to use it to support cast of references.

This CL fixes following casts:



struct MyInt {

int val;

};

struct DerivedInt : MyInt {};

void f(DerivedInt& ref) {

(void) unsafe_raw_ptr_static_cast(ref); // Fixed UB

(void) unsafe_raw_ptr_reinterpret_cast(ref); // Fixed UB

}



Prior to this CL, |Source| template type argument was deduced as

|DerivedInt|, not |DerivedInt&|. That makes |unsafe_raw_ptr_***_cast| to

return a reference to stack-allocated function argument and its usage is

UB.



Bug: 1475895

entry.title: avif_image_decoder: Always use RGBA for half float
entry.content:
When decoding to half float, the pixel ordering is always RGBA and

does not change depending on the platform (unlike 8-bit, where

Android uses a different pixel ordering than other platforms).



This CL fixes a bug where high bitdepth images are rendered

incorrectly when decode_to_half_float_ is set to true.



Test: newly added unit tests pass (they fail without this CL).

entry.title: OptGuide Model Executor: Add an explicit flag to preload the model
entry.content:
For use cases where the model should not be preloaded, but the caller wishes to use custom logic for calling `UnloadModel`, this additional flag is needed.



This CL should address a detected memory leak in BrowsingTopics where the model (several MBs) is sitting unused in memory most of the time because it does use custom model unloading logic, but does not need the model to be preloaded. (Detected memory leak as in the unused allocation is being flagged as a leak but is never actually leaked in the sense of something like unique_ptr.release()).



Callers who wish to have a tflite model available at anytime without needing to be loaded from disk should set `SetShouldUnloadModelOnComplete(false)` and `SetShouldPreloadModel(true)`.



BUG=1421496,1403525

entry.title: [BRP/clang-plugin] No raw_ptr enforcement to ptrs in STACK_ALLOCATED()
entry.content:
- raw_ptr usage on-stack context (e.g. function parameter) is

optional and not enforced.

Member fields in STACK_ALLOCATED() objects are known to be always

on-stack, so we should not enforce raw_ptr usage there.

This CL will exclude there from enforcement.

- This CL is effective only if `check-raw-ptr-to-stack-allocated` is

activated. It is not enabled yet.



Note:

raw_ptr pointing to STACK_ALLOCATED() is already excluded from

enforcement. https://crrev.com/c/4542127

This CL adds exclusion for raw_ptr as a member of

STACK_ALLOCATED() struct/class.



struct Foo {

STACK_ALLOCATED();

raw_ptr ptr1; // OK, but not recommended

int* ptr2; // Allowed by crrev.com/c/4800771 (this CL)

}

struct Bar {

raw_ptr ptr1; // Disallowed by crrev.com/c/4542127

Foo* ptr2; // Allowed by crrev.com/c/4542127

}



Change-Id: I41bfe1d0b1289420dbaa479180b0d8e8023b35a5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4800771

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

entry.title: Move tab search input into the main component
entry.content:
The wrapper for the text search is actually quite thin, so I don't think

we gain that much by encapsulating it within its own component. The

shadow dom barries makes it considerably more difficult and we have to

hack around the inability to cross the boundaries ourselves (which

accounted for ~30% of the code in the search wrapper anyway).



This change moves the input into the main app component so that we can

utilize aria-roles and attributes to announce and bring focus to th

relevant elements.

entry.title: snap_groups: Refactor clamshell split view
entry.content:
This moves clamshell intermediate split view functionalities to

SplitViewOverviewSession. This will observe a window in intermediate

split view and decide when to start/end overview.



This will allow us to separate clamshell split view from

SplitViewController and initialize SplitViewOverviewSession directly

from SnapGroupController, and move/rename it easily.



Note that this still relies on SplitViewController to update

`divider_position_` for incoming bounds calculations and NotifyDividerPositionChanged() to update the overview bounds.



Also moves some APIs from SplitViewController and overview_test_util to

overview_utils.



Test: existing + modified

entry.title: Fix Windows OOP print cancel handling after PDF conversion failure
entry.content:
Correct job cancel handling for out-of-process printing after the

Windows conversion from PDF to target language fails. Since there can

be pending asynchronous commands, the PrintJobWorkerOop needs to more

closely track the cancel request and avoid sending any further data

to the Print Backend service.

entry.title: Change handling of AutogeneratedTheme and UsingDeviceTheme
entry.content:
AutogeneratedTheme is the old representation of theme colors. UsingDeviceTheme enables the browser to follow the OS colors. AutogeneratedTheme is represented as a CustomThemeSupplier. Fix

behavior where UsingDeviceTheme was true but the AutogeneratedTheme

was being used to style the browser.



The change in ThemeService fixes the return value of UsingDeviceTheme.

To fix the colors, without clearing the theme from prefs,

UsingDeviceTheme controls if we provide a null ThemeSupplier instead of

the configured one.

entry.title: [Nearby] Add third db to separate remote and local public credentials.
entry.content:
Nearby Presence has two types of public credentials: remote and local.

Because the db is only able to store fields provided in the proto

and the type of public credential is not a field in the Nearby protos,

a third database is added to separate the two types of public

credential (despite being the same proto). This allows for them to

be returned by public credential type when later retrieved.



Full design doc at go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-storage.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Histograms superseded by two new histograms.

The previous histogram was not emitted to as this feature is still

under development.

entry.content:
When calculating combobox menu bounds, clip them to the display work

area, and make the menu scrollable.

that is likely to change the combobox bounds in screen coordinates.

entry.title: Soften Viewport size DCHECK in XrWebglLayer
entry.content:
When Chrome is paused, particularly it seems on older devices, the GPU

process may be killed which results in a ContextLoss. This ContextLoss

can cause issues for inline sessions upon resuming Chrome, when they

attempt to update the size of the viewports, and the new size is 0

because this context has been lost. This change softens the DCHECK that

would previously occur into simply an early return and a log statement

if we received a zero-sized viewport without a context loss. In the

case of context loss, the session is theoretically recoverable if the

page was appropriately listening for the context loss event and provides

the session with a new base layer (though admittedly inline sessions are

rare enough and inline sessions who appropriately handle this case are

likely even rarer), so this was chosen over simply ending the session.

Until that time the session may try to function with the old viewport

sizes; however, since the context is lost it will be unlikely to

actually succesfully composite anything.



Fixed: 1474999

Change-Id: I575574098b096aa3ea06f451ad16402dc4fcdd6d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4824588
